context: At the 2004 Summer Olympics, Bermuda competed in <a0_0><b4_0>sailing, athletics, swimming, diving, triathlon and equestrian events<a0_0/>.<b4_0/> In those Olympics, Bermuda's Katura Horton-Perinchief <a1_0><b5_0>made history by becoming the first black female diver to compete in the Olympic Games.<b5_0/><a1_0/> Bermuda has had one Olympic medallist, Clarence Hill, who won a <a2_0>bronze medal in boxing.<a2_0/> Bermuda also competed in <b6_0>Men's Skeleton<b6_0/> at the 2006 Winter Olympics in Turin, Italy. Patrick Singleton placed 19th, with a final time of 1:59.81. <b7_0>Jillian Teceira<b7_0/> competed in the Beijing Olympics in 2008. It is tradition for Bermuda to <a3_0>march in the Opening Ceremony in Bermuda shorts<a3_0/>, regardless of the summer or winter Olympic celebration. Bermuda also competes in the <b8_0>biennial Island Games<b8_0/>, which it hosted in 2013.
